Functions
00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag
GP_050_Cancellation

 TestCase_GC00310_MultiSessionKeepAlive_OpenSessionUnmaskCancelParallel () mc_multi_session_keep_alive)
 
 TestCase_GC00311_MultiSessionKeepAlive_InvokeCommandUnmaskCancelParallel () mc_multi_session_keep_alive)
 

Detailed Description

Description:
: Verify that TEE_GetCancellationFlag corresponds to the expected value for various scenarios of cancellation and non-cancellation. 
           bool TEE_GetCancellationFlag(
                      void );

           The TAs are the same as for the other TA modes tests.

           CA setup:
              Open a session using the appropriate TA (TA session type specified in the test name)
              The TA should be opened with three IN params, and one OUT param
              IN[0] contains the command of which test to execute in the TA code
              IN[1] contains and amount of time in ms to wait in a loop when testing with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP
              IN[2] contains flags to control calling options:
                     UNMASK: unmask when the command is called
              Expect TEE_SUCCESS for the open session command
              When a cancellation request is to be sent, it is sent by a separate thread
              When a cancellation request is to be sent, the CA should measure the amount of time before the open and invoke commands take to complete

           TA:
              if IN[2] contains a flag, UNMASK, then the TA should call TEE_UnmaskCancellation()
              TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE: immediately read the cancellation flag and write its value in the OUT param
              TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP:      read the cancellation flag in a loop calling a cancellable function, i.e. TEE_Wait(), with a time of 50ms
                                                per loop iteration, and a maximum number of iterations to stop the loop dependent on IN parameter 2 in ms.
                                                The algorithm should return TEE_ERROR_CANCEL when a cancellation occurs. (warning: potential race condition?)
                                                Return the final cancellation flag and write its value in the OUT param.
              return TEE_SUCCESS

           CA tear down:
              Close the session, expect TEE_SUCCESS

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00101_MonoSession_InvokeCommandUnmaskNoCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag can be retrieved and its value is false if no cancellation requests have been made.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE Invoke the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A

GP_050_Cancellation.00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag.GC00121_MultiInstance_InvokeCommandUnmaskNoCancel
TestCase_GC00200_MonoSession_OpenSessionUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag can be retrieved and its value is true after a cancellation request has been made.
Test Steps:
For a cancellation time of [100ms, 1s, 2s]: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with "cancellation time" The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should not be changed since TA does not execute the command The CA should measure execution time out "cancellation time" ms +/-50ms
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A

GP_050_Cancellation.00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag.GC00201_MonoSession_InvokeCommandUnmaskCancel
TestCase_GC00205_MonoSession_OpenSessionNoUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag can be retrieved and its value is true after a cancellation request has been made.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A

GP_050_Cancellation.00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag.GC00211_MultiSession_InvokeCommandUnmaskCancel
TestCase_GC00212_MultiSession_OpenSessionUnmaskCancelParallel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag from one session does not affect another session of the same TA.
Test Steps:
Thread 1: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened The CA should measure execution time out 100ms +/-50ms Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 1s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 2s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened Thread 2: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 10s The CA should measure execution time out 10s +/-100ms The value of the cancellation flag for this TA (in OUT) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP
Manual Execution:
No

No

TestCase_GC00215_MultiSession_OpenSessionNoUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag can be retrieved and its value is true after a cancellation request has been made.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA

TestCase_GC00222_MultiInstance_OpenSessionUnmaskCancelParallel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag from one session does not affect another session of the same multi-instance TA.
Test Steps:
Verify that the cancellation flag from one session does not affect another session of the same multi-instance TA. Thread 1: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened The CA should measure execution time out 100ms +/-50ms Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 1s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 2s +/-100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation happened Thread 2: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 10s The CA should measure execution time out 10s +/-100ms The value of the cancellation flag for this TA (in OUT) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP

GP_050_Cancellation.00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag.GC00223_MultiInstance_InvokeCommandUnmaskCancelParallel
TestCase_GC00225_MultiInstance_OpenSessionNoUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag can be retrieved and its value is true after a cancellation request has been made.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-50ms The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 1s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and NOT UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 2s The CA should measure execution time out 5s +/-100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA

TestCase_GC00300_MonoSessionKeepAlive_OpenSessionUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag is false when a TA is re-opened after cancellation of a previous instance.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA The CA should measure execution time out 100ms +/-50ms Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP

GP_050_Cancellation.00100_TEE_GetCancellationFlag.GC00300_MonoSessionKeepAlive_OpenSessionUnmaskCancel
TestCase_GC00301_MonoSessionKeepAlive_InvokeCommandUnmaskCancel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag is false when a TA is re-opened after cancellation of a previous instance.
Test Steps:
Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_IMMEDIATE and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP

For a cancellation time of [100ms, 1s, 2s]: Invoke the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with "cancellation time" The return value should be TEEC_ERROR_CANCEL, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should not be changed since TA does not execute the command The CA should measure execution time out "cancellation time" ms +/-50ms

TestCase_GC00310_MultiSessionKeepAlive_OpenSessionUnmaskCancelParallel ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Verify that the cancellation flag is false when a TA is re-opened after cancellation of a previous instance.
Test Steps:
Thread 1: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 5s The CA in parallel should send a cancellation request with 100ms The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP The OUT parameter should show TRUE, showing that cancellation reached the client TA The CA should measure execution time out 100ms +/-50ms Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK The returned cancellation flag (in the OUT param) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP Thread 2: Open the TA with TEST_CANCELLATION_FLAG_LOOP and UNMASK and a loop time of 10s The CA should measure execution time out 10s +/-100ms The value of the cancellation flag for this TA (in OUT) should be FALSE The return value should be TEE_SUCCESS, origin==TEEC_ORIGIN_TRUSTED_APP
